items.label: <title> tag present and optimized
items.description: Unique and relevant title with keywords

details.explication: The title tag is one of the most important elements for SEO. It appears in the browser tab and in search results. It must be unique for each page and contain the main keywords naturally.
commentFaire: Right-click on your page -> 'View page source' -> Look for the <title> tag
Use Chrome extension 'SEO Meta in 1 Click' to analyze your titles
Test with Google Search Console tool to see appearance in SERPs
Check length with online tool 'Title Tag Length Checker'
bonnesPratiques: Length between 50 and 60 characters (visible in SERPs)
Include main keyword at the beginning of title
Unique for each page of the site
Descriptive and attractive to encourage clicks
Include brand name at the end

exemple.html:
<head>
  <title>SEO Agency Paris - Natural Search Engine Optimization | Serpenter</title>
</head>
exemple.description: Example of optimized title with main keyword, description and brand

details.explication: The meta description appears in search results under the title. It directly influences click-through rate (CTR) and must summarize the page content attractively while including important keywords.
commentFaire: Inspect your page (F12) -> Look for <meta name="description"> tag
Use 'Meta Description Generator' tool to create optimized descriptions
Test appearance with 'Google SERP Simulator'
Check length with 'Meta Description Length Checker'

exemple.html:
<head>
  <meta name="description" content="SEO agency in Paris specialized in search engine optimization. Improve your visibility with our natural referencing services.">
</head>
exemple.description: Optimized meta description with keyword and call-to-action

details.explication: The H1 is the main title of the page and has the most SEO weight. There should only be one per page for clear hierarchy and good understanding by search engines. It's the most important title on your page.
commentFaire: Use Chrome extension 'Web Developer' -> Information -> View Document Outline
Search for 'h1' in source code (Ctrl+F)
Use 'Heading Structure Checker' tool to analyze your hierarchy
Check with 'HTML Validator' to detect errors

exemple.html: SEO Agency Paris - Natural Search Engine Optimization
exemple.description: Example of optimized H1 with main keyword

items.label: Logical heading structure (H1 > H2 > H3)
items.description: No level skipping, readable for engines

details.explication: The heading hierarchy must be logical and respect the order H1 > H2 > H3. Avoid level skips that can confuse search engines and harm content understanding. It's like a document outline.
commentFaire: Use 'Web Developer' extension -> Information -> View Document Outline
Analyze with 'Heading Structure Checker' to detect skips
Use 'Screaming Frog' to audit your entire structure
Check with 'HTML Validator' for structure errors
bonnesPratiques: Logical hierarchy: H1 -> H2 -> H3 -> H4...

exemple.description: Example of logical and accessible heading hierarchy

details.explication: URLs must be descriptive, short and include relevant keywords. Avoid technical parameters and special characters. A good URL helps with SEO and user understanding.
commentFaire: Analyze your current URLs with 'URL Structure Checker'
Use 'Google Search Console' to see indexed URLs
Test with 'URL Rewrite Tool' to optimize your URLs
Check with 'Screaming Frog' to audit all your URLs

exemple.description: Example of optimized vs non-optimized URL

details.explication: The alt attribute describes the image content for search engines and screen readers. It improves accessibility and can help with image ranking in Google Images.
commentFaire: Inspect your images (right-click -> Inspect) -> Look for alt attribute
Use 'Web Developer' extension -> Images -> Display Alt Attributes
Test with 'Alt Text Checker' to analyze your images
Check with 'Google Images' to see your image indexing

exemple.description: Image with alt text optimized for SEO

details.explication: Internal links help search engines understand your site structure and distribute PageRank between your pages. They also improve user experience by facilitating navigation.
commentFaire: Use 'Screaming Frog' to analyze all your internal links
Test with 'Internal Link Checker' to identify opportunities
Check with 'Google Search Console' -> Links -> Internal links
Analyze with 'Ahrefs' or 'Majestic' for complete audit

exemple.html: Discover our SEO optimization services to improve your visibility.
exemple.description: Internal link with descriptive and contextual anchor

details.explication: The canonical tag tells search engines which is the main version of a page when there are multiple URLs pointing to the same content. It avoids duplicate content issues.
commentFaire: Inspect your page (F12) -> Look for <link rel="canonical">
Use 'Canonical URL Checker' to analyze your canonicals
Check with 'Google Search Console' -> Coverage -> Duplicate content errors
Test with 'Screaming Frog' to audit all your canonicals

details.explication: The XML sitemap lists all important pages on your site and helps search engines discover and index them. It must be submitted to Google Search Console and be accessible via /sitemap.xml.
commentFaire: Check sitemap existence: yoursite.com/sitemap.xml
Submit your sitemap in Google Search Console -> Sitemaps
Validate your sitemap with 'XML Sitemap Validator'
Check that all your important pages are included

details.explication: The robots.txt file tells search engine robots which pages they can or cannot explore. It must be accessible at the root of your site (yoursite.com/robots.txt).
commentFaire: Access yoursite.com/robots.txt to check existence
Check syntax with 'Robots.txt Validator'
Test with 'Google Search Console' -> URL Inspection -> robots.txt
Make sure sitemap is referenced

exemple.txt:
User-agent: *
Allow: /
Disallow: /admin/
Disallow: /private/
Sitemap: https://serpenter.fr/sitemap.xml
exemple.description: Robots.txt with clear directives and referenced sitemap

details.explication: Structured data helps search engines understand your page content and can generate rich snippets in search results. They improve visibility and click-through rate.
commentFaire: Identify content type (Article, Organization, LocalBusiness...)
Use 'Schema.org Generator' to create your structured data
Test with 'Google Rich Results Test' to validate
Check with 'Structured Data Testing Tool'

exemple.html:
<script type="application/ld+json">
{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "Organization",
  "name": "Serpenter",
  "url": "https://serpenter.fr",
  "logo": "https://serpenter.fr/logo.png",
  "description": "SEO Agency in Paris",
  "address": {
    "@type": "PostalAddress",
    "streetAddress": "123 Rue de la Paix",
    "addressLocality": "Paris",
    "postalCode": "75001",
    "addressCountry": "FR"
  }
}
</script>
exemple.description: Structured data for organization with address

details.explication: Breadcrumbs improve user navigation and can appear in search results. They also help with local SEO by showing your site hierarchy to search engines.
commentFaire: Check breadcrumbs presence on your pages
Implement with BreadcrumbList structured data
Test with 'Google Rich Results Test'
Check appearance in SERPs

exemple.html:
1. Home
  2. Services
  3. SEO Audit
exemple.description: Breadcrumbs with semantic HTML and structured data
